Description: Ostracon (?), large section of the upper-body and neck of a brown pottery storage-vessel, the lower body and neck are ribbed and one handle survives, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of one line of white-painted Coptic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394939) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394939)
